profile_positions.description:
In the Biophotonics and Medical Imaging Group, a wide range of different skills and know-how are joined together to develop new methods, tools, and instruments for the diagnosis, understanding, and treatment of life threatening diseases and impairing medical conditions 

Support the group with following task:
-	Responsible of the groups laboratory: optical -, wet laboratory and cleanroom (laboratory manager)
-	Regular maintenance of existing equipment
-	Assist with selection of new equipment  
-	Designing, fabricate and testing optical, mechanical and electrical equipment/prototypes
-	Involved in the whole process of relocation of laboratories and cleanroom to a newly designing building
-	Supporting researchers with moving setups for doing experiments in different hospitals. 
-	Guiding (PhD) students with using high end equipment like laser-, microscopy setups, fibre splicing machine.
-	Controlling laser and lab safety
profile_positions.title: Research Engineer

profile_positions.description:
CarbonX is a company that originated from Delft University of Technology and specializes in materials science. Produced an innovative carbon network that enables better material properties. Products that CarbonX enhances: Elastomers, Thermoplastics, Thermosets and Batteries. 

Thermo-Plastic & Elastomers operator/ Laboratory technician
Process and characterise the different grades of CarbonX powder in thermoplastic and finding the limits of the processability. Tasks:
-	Responsible of the process laboratory
-	Preparing and running the experiments/tests for internal and external collaborators. 
-	Operate and optimize processing settings of extruders, water bath, pelletizer, injection mould machine.
-	Solve malfunction and do maintenance of the equipment. 
-	Improve and/or upgrade the (supporting) equipment.
-	Characterize the produced composites by different analyses (e.g. TGA, MFI, moisture content, dispersion, tensile test, impact test, conductivity tests, hardness, abrasion, mooney viscometer, RPA, etc.)
-	Data analysis and reporting 
-	Supervision of students during their education program.
-	Handyman for all business units of CarbonX
profile_positions.title: Laboratory Technician Elastomers & Thermo-Plastic

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the technical support for compounds production, test planning and execution, data analysis and reporting and lab consulting
profile_positions.title: Laboratory Technician Thermo-Plastics

profile_positions.description: I am a guest researcher at the TUdelft, but R&D project from Whirlwind international. Because interaction with a multidisciplinary environment was considered essential for success the R&D was located at Process & Energy (P&E) of the TU Delft.  I was hired by the TU to participate in a multidisciplinary projects and teams. All research projects resulted into scientific papers where I contributed as (co-)author. I have also gained experience in the guidance of a graduate student, as well as in supporting PhD students and academic staff members with their experiments and equipment.
profile_positions.title: Guest Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Another application of VibroCav technology is treatment of waste water sludge to achieve improved anaerobic sludge digestion. Task like: design of the demonstration of full scale high pressure equipment for waste water sludge, making measurement protocols, experimenting, (biochemical) analyses, maintenance equipment and ensuring good communication between the different parties. 
At the same time research going if the VibroCav technology is suited for purify (drinking) water 
During the different talks with KWR there was a discussion if the VibroCav technology was suited for drink water purification
-	Design of a measurement protocol for the proof of concept in the 50 Bar test circuit, taking into account the flow and pressure limits of the test circuit as well as the properties of the sludge
-	Performing experiments to validate the proof of concept and reporting the successful outcome.
-	Daily supervision of an applied science student during her graduation program.
-	Design of a 35 Bar test circuit (1 m3 - 30 m3 / hr flowrate at a max 10 Bar surrounding pressure) and of a VibroCav tool suitable for full-scale treatment of sludge in a sewage treatment plant. The sludge has a high viscosity and contains particles up to 3 mm diameter.
-	Setup of a measurement protocol and doing extensive tests under different process conditions
-	Operating anaerobic digestion reactor 
-	Reporting the results regularly, both in writing and by oral presentations, for the participants of the TKI project.
-	Substantial contribution to the final TKI report entitled " Actieve hydrodynamische cavitatie voor effectieve slibontsluiting ". (Active hydrodynamic cavitation for effective sludge digestion)
profile_positions.title: Senior Research And Development Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Whirlwind International BV that was engaged in innovative R&D: development of a ‘VibroCav’ tool - based on a vibrating ball inside a pipe - for regeneration of oil or water wells, using  fundamental knowledge of hydrodynamics around objects in confined space. 
Studied the working principle of the VibroCav tool by designing vibrating tools in high-pressure equipment, by measuring cavitation and vibration regimes in a spectrum of process conditions, by data acquisition and processing, by analysis of the data and by flow modelling (CFD). To analyse the behaviour of the ball and flow patterns I worked with a high-speed camera with (laser) light sheet and used small acoustic sensors.
-	Doing a literature search independently on the working principle of flow/vortex induced vibration and / or cavitation in a confined space.
-	Design of a 50 bar test circuit (250 l) suitable for surrounding pressures up to 10 bar and temperatures up to 110 ºC and design of different prototypes of VibroCav tool.
-	Implementing safety aspects/rules for test circuit according to Lloyd's Register and TU Delft.
-	In depth performing experiments with the VibroCav Tool to determine the different vibration and / or cavitation regimes depending on the process conditions at the selected physical parameters.
-	Implementation of analytical techniques with data-acquisition/image processing/analyses to study the flows, cavitation, vibration, and rotation phenomena at the VibroCav Tool
-	Participation in testing of a new test circuit (300 l) suitable for ambient pressures up to 350 bar
-	Participation field testing of the tool in a water well. 
-	Reporting results implemented in the dissertation of T.W. Bakker (VibroCav Hydrodynamic Vibration and Cavitation Technology, 2012)
profile_positions.title: R&D Engineer

profile_positions.description: building optical setup and automatically signal processing to measure the curviness of aspherical mirrors.
